channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023120189
item.description:
Report X-2023120189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a bulk truck in wet condition. Put on hazmat gloves, placed package into a damage bin and relocated damaged hazmat to the QA cage for further investigation. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 contained bottles had loose caps which caused leakage throughout packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was handled with hazmat gloves and taken to a QA cage to inspect further. Absorbency pads placed in the semi-damp areas, but it did not seem that there was too much release.

item.title: Report X-2023111159
item.description:
Report X-2023111159

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found in the outbound sort, brought to QA. package was place in the proper spill container. DescribePack: side of the package was wet and it was starting to become punctured DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: contents was placed upright so liquid was away from lid

item.title: Report X-2023110457
item.description:
Report X-2023110457

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBRX 710450 was found in the Belen yard to be leaking a small stream out of the bottom outlet valve assembly on to the ballast. No injuries or exposures. No waterways or storm drains impacted. Upon inspection, the BOV cap was tight, but the plug was less than tool-tight. The BOV was closed, suspect a bad valve. Plug was tool-tightened and leak subsided.
